login.page_subtitle: Please login to manage system configuration

default_account.title: Default Administrator Account
default_account.warning: Please change the default password in production environment

step1.title: Get Cloudflare Account ID
step1.description:
1. Login to Cloudflare Dashboard
2. Find the three-dot button (‚ãÆ) in the right sidebar and click it
3. Find and copy the Account ID from the dropdown menu
step1.hint: Account ID is a 32-character hexadecimal string, like: 1234567890abcdef1234567890abcdef

step2.title: Create API Token
step2.description:
Click "Create Token", select "Create Custom Token", and set the following permissions:

üîë Required Permissions:
‚Ä¢ Account : Account Settings: Read - Read account information
‚Ä¢ Account : Workers KV Storage: Read - Read KV data

üîç Domain Check Features (Optional):
‚Ä¢ Zone : Zone: Read - Read domain list
‚Ä¢ Account : Email Routing Rules: Read - Read Email Routing configuration

After adding these permissions, the system will be able to automatically detect your domains and verify Email Routing configuration status.
step2.hint: Copy the generated Token to the "API Token" field below (shown only once, please save it properly)

step3.title: Create KV Namespace
step3.description: Go to Workers & Pages ‚Üí KV, click the "Create instance" button, enter a name (e.g., EMAIL_STORAGE)
step3.hint: After creation, copy the Namespace ID to the field below

step4.title: Deploy Cloudflare Worker
step4.description:
Click the "üöÄ Deploy to Cloudflare" button below to automatically deploy the Email Worker on Cloudflare.

The deployment process will automatically complete:
1. Create Worker instance
2. Configure KV Namespace binding
3. Deploy email processing code
4. Generate access endpoint

If one-click deployment fails, you can expand the "Manual Configuration Options" below for detailed steps.
step4.hint: Recommended to use the one-click deployment button for quick Worker deployment. After deployment, the Worker will automatically bind to your KV Namespace.

step5.title: Configure Email Routing
step5.description:
Set up email routing in Cloudflare Dashboard:

1. Select your domain
   ‚ö†Ô∏è If your domain hasn't been added to Cloudflare yet, please go to Cloudflare Dashboard to add the domain and complete DNS configuration first
2. Go to Email ‚Üí Email Routing
3. Click "Enable Email Routing"
4. After enabling, click the "Routing rules" tab
5. Find the Catch-All rule, click "Edit"
6. In the "Action" dropdown, select "Send to Worker"
7. Select Worker: temp-email-worker
8. Click Save
step5.hint: The Catch-All rule will forward all emails sent to this domain to the Worker for processing

check_messages.token_failed: ‚ùå API Token verification failed, please check if Token is correct

check_messages.check_complete_success: ‚úÖ Check complete! All configurations are normal.
check_messages.api_token_manual: API Token cannot be automatically retrieved, manual creation required

flow_diagram.step1_desc:
User sends an email to the temporary mailbox address (e.g., test@yourdomain.com)
Email server queries DNS MX records to determine the receiving mail server
flow_diagram.step1_detail: Example: gmail.com ‚Üí DNS Query ‚Üí yourdomain.com MX record
flow_diagram.step2_desc:
DNS MX record points to Cloudflare Email Routing
Email is routed to Cloudflare infrastructure for processing
flow_diagram.step3_desc:
Cloudflare receives the email and verifies the sender
Triggers the configured Email Worker for custom processing
flow_diagram.step3_detail: Configuration Location: Cloudflare Dashboard ‚Üí Email ‚Üí Email Routing ‚Üí Routes
flow_diagram.step4_desc:
JavaScript Worker intercepts the email and performs the following operations:
‚Ä¢ Parses email content (plain text + HTML)
‚Ä¢ Extracts sender, recipient, subject, timestamp
‚Ä¢ Generates unique email ID (based on content hash)
flow_diagram.step5_desc:
Store email data to Cloudflare Workers KV (key-value database)
‚Ä¢ Key format: mail:{email address}:{timestamp}
‚Ä¢ Automatically sets 1-hour expiration (TTL=3600 seconds)
‚Ä¢ Maintains mail index list for each mailbox (max 50 emails)
flow_diagram.step6_desc:
Python backend reads data through Cloudflare KV API:
‚Ä¢ Uses Account ID + Namespace ID + API Token for authentication
‚Ä¢ Calls Cloudflare REST API to retrieve emails
‚Ä¢ Returns JSON-formatted email data to frontend
flow_diagram.step7_desc:
Web frontend displays email content:
‚Ä¢ Shows email list (sender, subject, time)
‚Ä¢ Shows detailed email content (plain text + HTML)
‚Ä¢ Automatically extracts verification codes (using LLM or regex)
flow_diagram.advantage1: Zero Cost: Cloudflare Workers KV free tier is sufficient (100,000 reads per day)
flow_diagram.advantage2: High Performance: Global CDN nodes with millisecond response times
flow_diagram.advantage3: Secure and Reliable: Emails automatically expire, no worries about data leaks
flow_diagram.advantage4: Easy to Scale: Supports multiple custom domains, easily expand temporary mailbox service

cloudflare.checker_info_line3: ‚Ä¢ Suggestion: Test the functionality first (generate a mailbox and try receiving emails), if it works normally, you can ignore the checker warnings

llm.default_method_hint: Set the default extraction method when frontend calls API. LLM mode is smarter but requires API Key, pattern training is based on admin-learned rules and costs less.
llm.pattern_training_info: ‚ÑπÔ∏è Paste email sample, select verification code text, then click „ÄåLearn Pattern„Äç, the system will automatically recognize keywords and save extraction rules

about.title: About Service
about.description: Providing secure and reliable temporary email service

footer.warning: For testing purposes only, do not receive sensitive or important information

api_docs.title: Temporary Email Service
api_docs.description: API service for automatic temporary email generation and verification code reception

generate_email.description: Generate a new temporary email address with optional custom prefix and domain

params.domain: Specify domain (optional, must be in available domains list)

get_mails.description:
üÜï Automatically returns full email content:
- **content**: Full plain text content (cleaned)
- **htmlContent**: Full HTML content (cleaned and enhanced)
- Automatically fetches full content from Cloudflare KV in batch (if needed)

params.limit: Maximum number of results (1-100, recommended to keep default value to control response size)

get_mail_detail.description: Get detailed content of a specific email, supports plain text and HTML

extract_codes.description:
Smart extraction of verification codes from all emails with multi-level strategy:

1. **Pattern-based extraction** - Learned patterns from admin training, highest priority
2. **LLM-based extraction** - OpenAI-compatible API intelligent extraction
3. **Regex-based extraction** - Multiple regex patterns with confidence scoring

Returns deduplicated verification code list with confidence scores.

wait_for_mail.description: Wait for new emails using long polling, returns immediately when new mail arrives or timeout occurs

get_domains.description: Returns list of available email domains, including:\n- Custom domains (Cloudflare Workers KV based)\n- Builtin domains (External API based)

health_check.description: Returns service status and configuration information

test_cloudflare.description: Test Cloudflare Workers KV connection and return configuration status
